result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Streich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: wih Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without victim and probation agent's consent. 
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------

Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

timeConds.notes: STAYED for Agent's use and with work release privileges.
Complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation WITHOUT buyout option.

Defendant Daniel J. Streich in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel J. Streich in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Haley Jo Rea appeared with intern Mackenzie Fagan for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel J. Streich in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH JOHANNA E. BEMIS.

Defendant Daniel J. Streich in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
